page.title: 19ROYAL OAK PUB,CARDINGTON
page.content: The 15th Century Royal Oak, a free house and the only pub in the village is still unspoilt. It is operated by a husband and wife team with 12 part-time helpers. Has a reputation for traditional ale and home-cooked food. Has a good mix of clientele all served from one bar. Enjoys a reasonable trade throughout the year bolstered by summer visitors,walkers, caravanners and cyclists. Dominoes is the main bar game but also has an indoor air-rifle shooting team. The pub opens every day of the year basically 12 noon to 2.30pm and 7pm to 11pm. The landlord and wife work a combined total of 170/200 hours per week. The licence to operate is granted by Ludlow Magistrates Court. Average consumption-230 barrels per year. Value about Â£140,000.
